body.name: ROHO MOSAIC Cushion, Standard, Inflatable Seat Cushion for Office Chair, Wheelchair, Cars, Home Living, & Back Pain Support, Adjustable Cushion with Stretchable Cover & Non-Skid Bottom, 18" x 16"
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by Medical Xpress Outlet. Seller Certifications:Minority-Owned Business
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 3 hrs 35 mins
features: Light, easily portable wheelchair cushion that works great for bedside chairs, car/truck seats and sporting events with a 315lbs/143kg weight limit
Ideal for individuals at risk for skin/soft tissue breakdown, experiencing pain, impaired sensation and looking for enhanced comfort in sitting
Designed to match the shape of the user, adapting to every movement to reduce risk of injury to skin/soft tissue even during longer sitting times
Features 3" easily inflated polyvinyl interconnected air cells, a non-skid cover, repair kit, instructions and hand inflation pump for easy set up
Comes with a 18" x 16" cushion and a breathable, stretchable Standard Cover that can be machine washed and air dried for cleaning
body.description: ROHO Cushions provide a comfortable, functional, and customizable sitting solution for people who may experience pain while sitting. Each adjustable, air-filled, segmented cushion is easy to set up and conforms to the users seated shape. It is designed to provide maximum comfort while protecting the skin and soft tissue from wound development. Light and portable to use anywhere prolonged sitting is required.

reviews.reviewText: This is the third one I have purchased. It is sooooo comfortable. One in my car for long trips, one on my office chair and one as a gift to a friend in a wheelchair. They are worth the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Compared to Ergo21, a winner
reviews.reviewText: I have hip pain stemming from sitting on hard surface wooden chairs too much. I bought this 18 x 16 size, as well as one of the gel type cushions from Ergo21. Both are kind of expensive and highly rated. After a month of using both on a daily basis, I have some observations.The Roho is a winner. It's thick enough, it's adjustable to whatever your weight happens to be, and it really does relieve the pressure points. As for the Ergo21, it just seems too thin, despite their claims that thin works great. Well, hmm, I beg to differ. I am left wondering, how can a single Ergo21 pad accommodate people ranging from 100 lbs or less up to 200lbs or more? Can't really unless it's adjustable, and these air cushions are adjustable. (For the record I weigh about 160.) On a hard surface chair for me at least, this Roho comes out a lot more comfortable, with the Ergo21 I still get that old butt ache coming through. The Ergo 21, it turns out is mostly a foam pad, with a very thin gel layer sandwiched sealed in vinyl on top of the foam. The gel pad is maybe 1/8" thick at most. I mean if it were a 2" or 3" gel layer, I would be very interested to try that. But honestly, fail to see what that minimal gel layer is really supposed to do. You sit on it and it just squishes around and you are really just sitting on a piece of foam. A pretty expensive piece of foam.Back to this Roho. You basically pump it up til it's firm, sit on it, and let out some air until you sink in a bit. First time I let a bit too much air out and my butt was hitting wood. Had to pump it back up a bit. But that's pretty much what you want, just enough air so you don't sink all the way down. The Roho is slightly odd in that when you shift your weight the air slowly moves from one chamber to another. It's a bit like being on a slowly rocking boat. But you do quickly get used to that and forget about it.I find the 18x16 to be too big for my wooden dining chair and kitchen high back stool. 16x16 would be about right. I will probably buy another Roho in that size.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Terrible product and experience
reviews.reviewText: Ordered this for my 93 year old grandfather who lives and sleeps in his recliner. It was recommended by his PT to replace the stacks of pillows and pads he'd concocted.I got him to try it once and he sat on it for 2 days before cussing it and everyone around who suggested it. I sat it aside for a few days, attempted to try it again, same results. He hates it and says it's uncomfortable. It's also nearly impossible to keep inflated using the included pump, which constantly falls apart and doesn't make enough pressure to inflate when someone is on the pad, which should be expected considering its intended use! Since I spent $100 on a seat cushion, my 95yo (but far more mobile) grandmother attempted to put it in her seat on the couch. She hated it too.It was delivered on Dec 28, now it's only Jan 12 and I'm being told it's ineligible for return, despite being within the 30 day returns window.This has been a horrible experience and waste of money all around.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It worked well (4 stars) for about 3 weeks (1 star)
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I have a post-surgical wound below my tail bone and it was recommended by PT in my rehab.Pro: It does work. I had been using a waffle cushion and the Roho Mosaic works much better albeit at a higher price. It is well thought out, for example with a carrying handle built into the cover and an accessible but non-interfering air valve. It comes with a small air pump and reasonably good instructions. I like the diagram on the side of the cover that shows how to orient the cushion before sitting on it.Con: You have to repump it some every few days, but that's not all that important as long as it is not too flat. Mine sprung a leak somewhere, I think in the air valve, after three weeks use making it totally unusable. I have no idea how that happened nor how often it happens. So, try to buy from somewhere that will replace it if you are unlucky.
Great product no more sore back so happy with this purchase
My husband had an operation and has been in terrible pain whilst sitting and lying. This product was true to description and has assisted in spreading his weight and easing his pain.

reviews.reviewTitle: Was a good choice for me and my backside problem
reviews.reviewText: The cushion was just what I had to have to ease sore spots on my backside

reviews.reviewTitle: Good quality. Has pump and instuctions.
reviews.reviewText: Tried it on recliner, but not suitable for plush surfaces as body tends to gravitate to worn side. But on unpadded rocker or walker it was fine. Took some adjusting of inflation as to much cuts off circulation above knees.CANPAR delivered and left at wrong address. Thank God for kind neighbour

Similar products from all other 3d party suppliers give refunds. This company does not say "no refunds" until th item is bought, Product was not opened but patient who needed it got one sooner and locally. It could be a good product but!!!
